DOC.brief_summary: To assess efficacy vortioxetine ( 10 20 mg/day ) adjunctive treatment stable selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) dose versus stable SSRI monotherapy cognitive performance ( focus aspect concern speed processing , executive function attention ) patient partial full remission Major Depressive Episode ( MDE ) .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Vortioxetine Cognitive Dysfunction Patients With Partial Full Remission Major Depressive Disorder

The patient HAMD17 total score ≤10 . The patient receive SSRI monotherapy MDE patient currently full partial remission ≥12 week license dos stable dose ≥8 week prior Screening Visit . The patient ≥50 % response current SSRI treatment ( Antidepressant Treatment Response Questionnaire [ ATRQ ] ) . The patient PDQD total score > 25 . The patient man woman , age ≥18 ≤65 year . The patient score ≥70 DSST ( number correct symbol ) Baseline Visit . The patient , opinion investigator , able complete neuropsychological test validly Baseline Visit . The patient physical , cognitive , language impairment severity adversely affect validity data derive neuropsychological test . The patient diagnose read disability ( dyslexia ) . The patient history lack response previous adequate treatment vortioxetine . The patient current psychiatric disorder Axis I disorder ( accord DSMIVTR™ criterion ) MDD , assess use Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview ( MINI ) . The patient current diagnosis dysthymic disorder within 3 month precede onset depressive episode patient currently full partial remission ( DSMIVTR™ criterion ) . The patient borderline , schizotypal , schizoid , paranoid , histrionic , antisocial personality disorder ( axis II ) comorbid primary diagnosis ( DSMIVTR™ criterion ) . The patient suffers personality disorder , mental retardation , pervasive development disorder , attentiondeficit/hyperactivity disorder , organic mental disorder , mental disorder due general medical condition ( DSMIVTR™ criterion ) .
